snippet: A report by the charity Oxfam offers a warning about deepening global inequality ahead of this week’s annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.
abstract: Oxfam releases study finding that world's richest 1 percent are set to control more than half of all global wealth by 2016, marking watershed in rise of income inequality; report, which comes days before annual World Economic Forum meeting, indicates that divide is starker than at any point in recent history.
lead_paragraph: A report by the charity Oxfam offers a warning about deepening global inequality ahead of this week’s annual World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

headline.main: Oxfam Study Finds Richest 1% Is Likely to Control Half of Global Wealth by 2016
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Global Wealth Is Flowing to the Richest
